q: Analyse the below puzzle and guess the value of X?

What purpose does the following pseudocode serve? What is the prerequisite for this algorithm?

Pseudocode

FUNCTION (INPUT arr[], INPUT l, INPUT h, INPUT key)
 INTEGER m = l+(h-l)/2
 IF arr[m] === key
  PRINT "Found at index m"
 ELSE IF arr[m]>key
  FUNCTION (arr, l, m-1, key)
 ELSE 
  FUNCTION (arr, m+1, h-1, key)
 ENDIF
ENDFUNCTION

Options

  1. It performs binary search and the array should be sorted for binary search to work effectively.
  2. It performs interpolation search and the array needs to be sorted for interpolation search to work.
  3. It's a function for dividing the array into 2 equal halves as in merge sort. There is no prerequisite.
  4. It's just a recursive function.

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(xy (a^2 + b^2) - ab (x^2 + y^2)\)

Simplify the following expression:

\(3 (3) (-2) - 2(-3) (-4) \div \frac{2}{3 \times 5} of \frac{3 \times 5}{4} - 3 + 2 \div 3 \div 4 \div 5\)

Simplify the following:

\(6\frac{2}{3} + 15\frac{1}{4} + 3\frac{3}{4} - 7\frac{2}{5}\)

Simplify the following:

\(15\frac{1}{4} - \frac{1}{3} \div 7\frac{3}{4} + 13\frac{2}{3}\)

What is the value of the following expression:

\(\frac{1}{log_{\frac{p}{q}} x} + \frac{1}{log_{\frac{q}{r}} x} + \frac{1}{log_{\frac{r}{p}} x}\)
If \(a + b = 4\) and \(a^2 + b^2 = 2\), which of the following is the value of \(ab\)?

What is the number of possible values of x in the following equation:

\(\sqrt {x^2 - x + 1} + \frac{1}{\sqrt {x^2 - x + 1}} = 2 - x^2\)
Bob notices that the hands of his wristwatch coincide with each other every 45 minutes. How much time will his watch lose per day in this scenario?

You are asked to use two pipes A and B to fill a tank that has another pipe C at the bottom of it. Given that pipes A and B can fill the tank in 15 and 20 minutes, respectively and pipe C can empty 5 gallons per minute from the tank.
In the given context, what is the capacity of the tank if all three pipes working together can fill the tank in 10 minutes?

You are filling a large bowl with a solution made up of 10 parts of water and 5 parts of syrup. How much of the mixture should be drawn out of the bowl and replaced with syrup so that the mixture is half water and half syrup?
Note: Assume that the bowl contains 15 liters of solution.

A shoemaker incurs an expense of Rs. 200 for producing a shoe. She also incurs an additional expenditure of Rs. 50,000, independent of the number of shoes produced. If she can sell a shoe during the season, she sells it for Rs. 300 else, she sells each shoe for Rs. 150. If she produces 2000 shoes, Determine the number of shoes that she must sell during the season to breakeven?
[Note: Assume that she can sell all the shoes produced]

A school has two alarms A and B. Alarm A rings once every two hours and alarm B rings once every four hours.

Determine the percentage by which the number of times A would ring in 24 hours is greater than the number of times alarm B would ring in that same period?
An inspector rejects 0.08% of the total number of machines as defective. How many machines will be examined?
If amongst three numbers, the second is twice the first and thrice the third. If the average of the numbers is \(44\), then what is the difference between the first number and the third number?

Bob purchased some number of pencils and divided it amongst his 3 friends. He gave it to them, one at a time. To each of them, he gave \(half\) of the pencils he had then, and \(two\) more besides. He kept \(one\) pencil with him. How many pencils did he purchase initially?

Which of these is a product of the following expressions:

\((1 + a), (1 + a^2), (1 + a^4),\) and \((1 - a)\)

Which of these is the correct relationship after eliminating \(x,\ y,\ and\ z\) from the following expression:

\(x + y = a\), \(y + z = b\), \(x + z = c\), and \(x + y + z = m\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(ab\) \(\Biggl( \) \(\frac{1}{a^2}\) + \(\frac{1}{b^2}\) \( \Biggr)\) + \(ab\) + \(\frac{1}{ab}\)

  1. \(\Biggl( \frac{1}{a} + \frac{1}{b} \Biggr)(a+b)\)
  2. \(\Biggl( {a} - \frac{1}{a} \Biggr)\Biggl( {1} - \frac{1}{b}\Biggr)\)
  3. \(\Biggl( {a} + \frac{1}{a} \Biggr)\Biggl( {b} + \frac{1}{b} \Biggr)\)
  4. \(\Biggl( {1} + {a} + \frac{1}{a} \Biggr) \Biggl( {1} + {b} + \frac{1}{b} \Biggr)\)
If \(USD\ 500\) amounts to \(USD\ 583.20\) in two years when compounded annually, what is the rate of interest per annum?
If \(a\) and \(b\) are the roots of \(3x^2 + 2x + 1\), then which of the following equations contains the roots, \(\frac{1-a}{1 + a}\) and \(\frac{1 - b}{1 + b}\)?
What is the excise duty on goods worth \(8500\) USD at 4 percent?

Simplify the following:

\(\frac{(.367)^2 + (.633)^2 - .367 \times .633}{.633 \times .633 \times .633 + .367 \times .367 \times .367}\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(p^2 + 4p + 3\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(9a^2 - b^2 - c^2 + 2bc\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(3x - 48x^3\)

Simplify the following:

\(2.35 \times .11 \div 2.5 + 315.5 - .0105\)
What is the value of \(log_\sqrt5 625\)?

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(2x^4 + x^3 - 4x - 2\)

A man can row 40 km upstream and 60 km downstream in 13 hours. He can also row 50 km upstream and 72 km downstream in 16 hours.
In the given context, what is the rate of the current?

Julian went to the market and bought fish worth Rs. 30 out of which 50 paise were spent as sales tax. What is the cost of tax-free items if the tax rate is 5%?
Note: Choose the option that coincides with the nearest integer.

A painter paints n number of paintings each month from March to June. He has sold n/2 number of paintings at the beginning of each month from July to February. He hasn't paid extra charges for storage from March through June, but he paid $ 0.10 per painting each month from July to February for the unsold paintings.
What was the total additional cost (in terms of n) for storage that the painter had to pay for the 12 months from March to February?

In what ratio should a vendor mix water with milk to gain 12 2/3% on selling the mixture at cost price?
Note: Choose the option that coincides with the nearest integer.

Bob has allocated a budget x for painting his shop. However, the price of paint increases by 45%. If Bob decides to spend an additional 30% of x for buying paint then by what percentage will the quantity of paint purchased be reduced?

Mr. John attends a party at his friend's house for Christmas in 2017. His friend introduces him to a girl named Alice who is a mathematician.
3 years later, Mr. John runs into Alice celebrating her 5th birthday on the 29th of February 2020.
If Mr. John remarks that he is only 2 years older than her, what is Mr. John's current age?

The sum of the ages of A and B at present is 7 times the difference in their ages. After 5 years, the sum of their ages will be 9 times the difference in their ages.
Determine the present age of the older one?

At what time will the minute hand and hour hand of a wall clock make one-third angle of the right angle between 8 PM and 9 PM?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

A student gets an aggregate of 60% marks in five subjects in the ratio 8:7:6:5:4. The passing marks are 40% of the maximum marks and each subject has the same maximum marks. In the given context, how many subjects did the student pass?
Rob sold an oven at a profit of 35%. If one-fifth of the selling price is Rs. 2,700, then what is 20% of the total amount that he paid to purchase the oven?

A library has a collection of books out of which 55% of books are more than 50 years old and 60% of books are less than or equal to 70 years old. Also, 40% of the total collection of books in the library is mostly fictional novels.
If 40% of the books that are more than 70 years old are fictional novels then, what percentage of fictional novels are less than or equal to 70 years?
Jim set his wristwatch to show the correct time at 9 AM. If the watch gains 10 minutes in 12 hours, determine the actual time when the watch shows 11 AM on the 6th day?

A scientist named Bob was exposed to some radiation which caused him to age backward after he turned 40. Four years later, his current age and his daughter Alice's age are in the ratio 3:1.
Determine the ratio of Bob's and Alice's age four years before Bob turned 40.

You have two pipes P1 and P2 that can fill a large bucket in 4 hours and 2 hours, respectively. Also, assume that you open the pipes at alternate hours.
In the given context, how many hours will it take to fill the bucket if you open P1 first?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

It takes 400 seconds for a train to completely cross two points A and B which are at a distance of 7.8 km.
Determine the speed of the trains, if the length of the train is 200 m?
Note: Assume that the values that are obtained after the decimal point are neglected.

A boatman goes 12 km against the current of the stream in 6 hours and goes 2 km along with the current in 50 minutes. How long will it take for him to go 8 km in still water?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.
The ratio of the time taken by three motorbikes to cover a particular distance is 3: 6: 9. Determine the ratio of the speeds of the bikes over the same distance?

The ratio of the score obtained by the two students is 4:3. The combined average of their score percent is 100 and the score obtained is 1400.
What is the total score of the exam conducted?
A and B are 50 and 70 years old, respectively. How many years ago was the ratio of their ages 2:3?

Two toy trains A and B run towards each other on a conveyor belt of length 2500 m. The speed of train A is 35 m/s, and the speed of train B is 15 m/s. Determine time taken by trains to collide, if the speed of the conveyor belt is 10 m/s?

Bob has a box of 14 origami papers out of which 5 are red in colour, 6 are blue in colour and 3 are black in colour.
In how many ways can he select the papers if he wants every selection to have at least 1 black paper and at least 1 blue paper?
You have a grandfather clock that is indicating the time as 6:35. What is the angle formed between the hour hand and the minute hand in the given scenario?

A retailer buys lentil A at Rs. 20.40 per kg and lentil B at Rs. 18.60 per kg. He wants to mix A and B to make a new mixture C that costs Rs. 19.40 per kg.
In what ratio should he mix lentil A and B to do so?
A clock gains 4 minutes after every 4 minutes. You set the correct time in the clock at 6:00 A.M. every day to deal with this issue. Determine the correct time when the clock shows 8:00 P.M.?

In a factory packing red and green apples, 6% of the apples were found to be defective. Also, 90% of the non-defective apples were red apples. If 4700 non-defective apples were all green, then how many apples in total were packed in the factory?

The present age of the father is 4 years more than thrice the age of his son. Three years later, the father's age will be 10 years more than twice the age of his son.
Determine the present age of the father (in years)?

Two trains A and B start at the same time from points P1 and P2 towards each other. After crossing each other, they take 25 seconds and 9 seconds to reach P2 and P1 respectively.
Determine the ratio of the speed of A to B?

You have a mixture of 100 liters of water and milk containing 25% milk.
The amount of milk that should be added to the mixture so that the percentage of milk in the new mixture becomes 30% is X.YZ liters when rounded off to two decimal places.
Determine the value of X + Y?

You have three pipes P1, P2, and P3 that fill a tank completely in 5 hours, 10 hours, and 15 hours, respectively. You open P1, P2, and P3 for 2 hours each in sequence.

Approximately, how many hours will P1 take to fill the tank completely?

You have a mixture of 100 liters of water and milk which contains 25% milk. Let the amount of milk that should be added to the mixture so that the percentage of milk in the new mixture is 30% be X.YZ liters when rounded off to two decimal places. What is the value of X + Y?
In how many rearrangements of the word PREJUDICE, is the letter J positioned in between the 2 Es?

In the year 2000, Alice turned 25 and gave birth to her son Bob. Due to some side effects, Alice stopped aging right after she gave birth. Now, the present ages of Alice and Bob are in the ratio 2:1.
What would the ratio of Alice and Bob's present ages be if Alice hadn't stopped aging?

Alice wants to sell artisanal drinks during the holiday season. He produces 160 litres of the drink and sells a part of it at 10% profit. He then sells the rest of the drink at 6% profit.
What quantity of the drink did he sell at 10% profit if he gained 9% profit on the entire 160 litres?

Alice is a flower seller who buys 85 roses at Rs. 350. Unfortunately, 5 of the roses were damaged and he could not sell them.
At what price should he sell each of the roses to make a profit of 17%?

T1 and T2 are two different times. The hour hand at time T1 and T2 have a difference of 67.5 degrees.

What is the time T2 if T1 is 12:15 A.M.?

There are X number of people standing on the circumference of a circle at distinct points. Each possible pair of persons, not standing next to each other, sings a two-minute song, one pair after the other. If the total time taken for singing is \(28 minutes\), what is X?

Two friends Alice and Bob have applied for a job in the same company. The possibility that Alice and Bob get selected for this job is \(\frac{3}{11}\) and \(\frac25\)respectively. What is the probability that both of them get selected for the job?

The reminders of three numbers, when divided by \(P\), is \(61,\ 67,\ and\ 79\) respectively. The remainder of the resultant sum of these three numbers, when divided by \(P\) is \(11\). Which of the following is the valid values of \(P\)?

a.option: More than one value is possible

q: If \(\frac {r}{s} = - \frac{1}{2}\), what is the value of \(\frac {r^2 + s^2}{r^2 - s^2}\)?

If \(9x + \frac{1}{x} = 10\), then what is the value of the following expression:

\(81x^2 - \frac{1}{x^2}\)
What is the average of first nine prime numbers?

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(x^8 - 1\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(1 - x^5 - x + x^4\)
If Michael, Mary, and James can complete a work in 20, 30, and 60 days respectively. In how many days can Micheal complete the work if Mary and James help him on every third day?

Jennifer can complete \( \frac{1}{4} th\) of a job in 3 days and Susan can complete \( \frac{1}{6} th \) of the same job in 4 days. If they work together USD 180 will be paid to them in total then what is the amount paid to Jennifer?
What is the value of \(log_{3\sqrt2} 5832\)?

Alice and Lisa complete a certain task in 18 days, Lisa and Paul can complete it 24 days, and Alice and Paul can complete it in 36 days. In how many days will Alice and Paul finish the task if they work individually?

a.option: Alice and Paul will take 48 and 144 days respectively.
Alice and Paul will take 45 and 148 days respectively.
Alice and Paul will take 30 and 144 days respectively.
Alice and Paul will take 48 and 133 days respectively.

q:
If \(a + b + c = 12\) and \(ab + bc + ca = 50\), what is the value of the following expression:

\(a^2 + b^2 + c^2\)
If \(a - 4\) is a factor of \(2a^4 - 3a^3 +4a^2 -5a + k\), which of the following is the value of k?
If Bob spends \(12\frac{1}{2}\%\) of a certain amount and his expenditure is \(80 USD\), then what is the total amount of money?
If \(18\%\) of a certain amount is equal to \(1440 USD\), then what is the total amount?
In a library, \(40\%\) books are in English, \(80\%\) of the remaining are in German, and the remaining \(240\) are in various other languages. What is the total number of books in the library?

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(1 + (x + y + z) + (xy + yz + zx) + xyz\)

A YouTuber decides to launch limited edition merchandise that includes bags, shoes, and jackets. In 2018, she launches the merchandise in the ratio 2:3:4, respectively. In 2019, she removes 'n' items from each type of merchandise launched in 2018 so that the new ratio is 3:5:7.
Similarly, in 2020, she removes 10 items from each type of merchandise produced in 2019 so that the ratio 1:2:3.
What is the total number of items that were removed from the merchandise launched in 2019?

You are baking a cake using rare ingredients A, B, and C. Assume that you put 45% of A in the cake. Additionally, you put B as 1/3 of the amount of ingredient C while baking the cake. If the amount of C used to bake the cake is 8 Tablespoons (Tbsp), then how many Tbsp of ingredients were put in the cake?
Note: Assume that no other ingredients apart from A, B and C were used in baking the cake and choose the option that coincides with the nearest integer.

Six fixed baskets have been numbered 1, 2,.....,6.
Each of the six baskets is to be filled up either with an apple or an orange in such a way that at least one basket contains orange and the baskets containing the oranges are consecutively numbered.
Determine the total number of ways in which this can be done?

Mango A worth Rs 130/kg and mango B worth Rs 120/kg is mixed with the third variety C in the ratio 1:1:2.
If the mixture is worth Rs 160, what is the price of the variety C mango?

John's and Bob's ages are in the ratio 3:4; Bob's and Lisa's ages are in the ratio 4:7, and Lisa's and Ben's ages are in the ratio 7:9.
Determine the ratio of John's and Ben's ages?

A wholesaler decides to mix two varieties of lentils worth Rs. 170 per kg and Rs. 180 per kg with a third variety of lentils in the ratio 2:2:3.
What is the price per kg of the third variety of lentils if the lentil mixture is worth 173 per kg?

The ratio of Ben's age 4 years ago and Anita's age after 4 years is 1:1. Presently, the ratio of their ages is 5:3.
What is the ratio of Ben's age 4 years hence and Anita's age 4 years ago?

4 units are drawn from a container full of milk and is then filled with water. This operation is performed two more times. The ratio of the quantity of milk now left in the container to that of water is 8:19.
How much milk did the container hold originally?

You are asked to form a CSR team consisting of 2 men and 2 women from a group of 5 men and 7 women.
In how many ways can you form the team if one man and one woman refused to work together?

You want to arrange digits 0 to 9 such that 1 and 2 always have 2 digits between them.
In how many ways can you do this without repeating any digit?

A large concrete bed is filled using five small pipes and two large pipes. Each of the five small pipes works at 2/5 the rate of the large pipe. If all the 7 pipes are opened at the same time, they should fill the entire bed in what fraction of time that it would have taken the large pipe alone?

Bob is using two taps A and B to fill a tank in 12 hours and 15 hours, respectively. He opens both the taps and observes that it took him 20 minutes more to fill the tank due to some leakage.
How long will the leakage take to empty a full tank in the given scenario?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

Jake owns a boat named Santa Maria. When Jake was born, Santa Maria had already been his family for 1/6th of his present age.
Assume that Santa Maria has turned 70 this year. Determine Jake's present age?

There are n balls, out of which B1 balls are alike, B2 balls are alike, B3 balls are alike and so on and Br balls are of rth kind such that (B1 balls+ B2 balls + B3 balls+......+Br balls) = n balls.
What is the number of permutations of n balls?

There are 16 pipes that are connected to a tank. Some of them are used to fill the tank and the others are used to drain the tank. Each of the fill pipes can fill the tank in 12 hours and each of the drain pipes can drain the tank completely in 8 hours.
If all the pipes and drain pipes are kept open, an empty tank gets filled in 12 hours. Determine the count of fill pipes out of all the 16 pipes?

You have a mason jar of juice containing 44% of lemon juice. You decide to replace a part of this juice with another juice containing 20% of lemon juice.
What fraction of juice did you replace if the mixture now contains 24% of lemon juice?

The letters E, E, G, M, and T can be used to form 5-letter strings such as MEGET or MGEET.
You have to use these letters to form 5-letter strings such that two occurrences of the letter E are separated by at least one letter.
Detrmine how many strings can be formed?

Two trains A and B are traveling in the same direction at a speed of 36 km/h and 72 km/h respectively. Train B approaches train A at t=0 and both are parallel after 30 seconds. Determine the length of train A?

A bus traveling from Bangalore to Hyderabad makes 4 stops during the entire journey. Four people enter the bus after it has started from Bangalore with four different tickets.
How many different sets of tickets can the four people possibly have in the given scenario?

On a particular day, Alice buys a wall clock from an online store which was set at 10:00 AM on the same day and delivered to him. Alice receives the clock three days later and notices that the clock is indicating 3:00 PM.
In the given scenario, determine what the true time is if the clock loses 10 minutes in 24 hours?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

Four glasses of sizes 2 units, 8 units, 12 units, and 16 units contain a mixture of juice & water in the ratio 1 : 1, 3 : 5, 7 : 5, and 9 : 7, respectively. The contents of all four glasses are poured into a single jar. Determine the ratio of juice & water in the resultant mixture?

Alice and Mary are two sisters who collect stamps as a hobby and have a total collection in the ratio 6:12, respectively. Mary gave some of her stamps to Alice and the ratio of the total collection of stamps changed to 7:8.
In the given context, determine the fraction of stamps that Mary gave to Alice from her original collection.

A newly appointed class teacher wants to assign a unique 5 digit roll number to her students. She also wants all the roll numbers to start with 14.
In how many ways can she form the roll numbers if no digit appears more than once?
Determine the time between 1:15 and 2:45 at which the hands of a clock are at right angles.

A newspaper hawker selling newspapers and magazines gets 7% commission on all sales up to Rs. 8,000. Additionally, for all sales above Rs. 8000, he gets 5% commission.
If the total sales amount after deducting his commission is Rs. 30,000, then what is the total sales made by him?

A coaching institute provides physics and mathematics classes to a group of students. The institute has male and female students in the ratio of 5:4 and a male student population of 1175.
Suppose, a few weeks later a group of male students join the institute and the ratio of male to female students becomes 3:2. What would the number of male students who joined the institute later be?

4 years ago, Bob was twelve times as old as his daughter and 4 years hence, four times his age will be equal to fourteen times that of his daughter.
Calculate the ratio of the present age of father and daughter after rounding off the values to their nearest integers?

You bought a vintage clock from an online store and set it at 8 AM. You notice that the clock gains 20 seconds every 5 minutes. If the clock shows 10:15 at night on the same day, what is the correct time?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

Bob set his wall clock at 8:00 AM and noticed that the clock gained 10 minutes every 12 hours. On the third day, he decided to reset the clock again at 8:00 AM.
If the clock indicates 12 PM on the 4th day, what will the true time be?
Note: Select the time in hours and minutes.

Your office has arranged for a box of food packets containing 2 packets of noodles, 3 packets of pasta and 4 packets of sushi.
In how many ways can you pick 3 food packets from the box, so that at least one of them contains pasta?

Bob bought a bicycle for Rs. 15,000 last year and sold it to Ben a loss of 10%. Ben then sold the bicycle to Lisa at a profit of 20% and Lisa sold it to Tara at a profit of 10%.

Determine how much Tara paid for the bicycle?

Two trains started at the same time from two stations which are 200 km apart and going in opposite direction, the trains cross each other at the distance of 110 km from one of the stations. What is the ratio of their speeds?
\( \frac{1}{2} \) is _______________________ percent of \( \frac{1}{3} \).

The jogging track in a sports complex is 726 m in circumference. John and Tara started from the same point and walked in the opposite direction in 4.5 km/hr and 3.75 km/hr respectively. At what time will they meet each other for the first time?
If a number is decreased by 4 and divided by 6, the result is 8. What will be the result if 2 is subtracted from the number and then it is divided by 5?
If \(log 2 = x\) and \(log 3 = y\), what is the value of \(log 108\)?
The difference between a number and its three-fourth is 50. What is the number?
Daniel completes a task in 10 days and Lisa completes the same task in 15 days. In how many days can they complete the task if they work together?

John completes a task in 7 days by working 9 hours every day and Bob completes the same task in 6 days by working 7 hours every day. How many days will they take to complete the task by working together for 8 hours per day?
Ben’s age after six years will be three-seventh the age of his father. If ten years ago, the ratio of their ages was 1:5 then what is the current age of Ben’s father's?
One year ago, the ratio of Mike’s and Bob’s age was 6: 7 respectively. Four years later, this ratio would become 7: 8. How old is Bob?

Simplify the following:

\(3\frac{1}{2}\Biggl(2\frac{1}{2}\Biggr) + 2\frac{1}{2} \div 3\frac{1}{2} \times 2\frac{1}{2}\ of\ 3\frac{1}{2} - 2\frac{1}{2}\)

  1. \(7\frac{1}{2}\)
  2. \(12\frac{1}{2}\)
  3. \(9\frac{1}{2}\)
If \(log \frac{a + b}{2} = \frac{1}{2} (log a + log b)\), what is the relation between \(a\) and \(b\)?
Bob takes 8 hours to complete a job and Ben takes 10 hours to complete the same Job. How long will it take if Bob and Ben work together but independently to complete the same job?
A sum of money is lent at a rate of 10% per annum for 2 years. It yields USD 8.81 more when compounded semi-annually than compounded annually. What is the sum lent?

Simplify the following:

\(3(3) of 3 \div 3 \times 3 - 3 + 3( -2 of 5)\)

Simplify the following:

\(4.53875 \div 1.25 + 31.75 \times 3.2\)
If \(\frac{log a}{y - z} = \frac{log b}{z - x} = \frac{log c}{x - y}\), what is the value of \(a^x \cdot byc^z\)?

What is the value of the following expression:

\(\frac{1}{2} log_{10} 25 - 2 log 3 + log_{10}18\)
Mike and Tara can complete a piece of work in 4 days together. If Mike alone can complete the same work in 12 days, in how many days can Tara alone complete that work?

If \(p = x^a, q = x^b,\) and \(x^2 = (p^bq^a)^c\), what is the value of the following expression:

\(a \cdot b \cdot c\)
A passenger train covers a distance of 300 km two hours earlier if its speed is increased by 5 km/hr from its normal speed. What is the regular speed of the train?
Determine the number of ways to arrange HACKEREARTH so that all the vowels are placed adjacent to each other?

Alice travels from California to Florida in eight different ways. She can return to California by using all the ways except the one she has used earlier. Determine the number of ways by which she can complete her journey.

If \(x - \frac{1}{x} = 2\), what is the value of the following expression:

\(x^4 + \frac{1}{x^4}\)
What is the compound interest on USD 10,000 in 2 years at 4% per annum if the interest is compounded semi-annually?
If \(a + \frac{1}{b} = 1\) and \(b + \frac{1}{c} = 1\), then what is the value of \(c + \frac{1}{a}\)?
If Bob's income is \(20\%\) more than Ben's, then what percent of Ben's income is less than Bob's income?

Simplify the following expression:

\(3 - 3(3) + 3(-2) - 3 of 2 \div 3 \div 2 \times 3 \times 2 + 3(5)\)
If \(\frac{a}{.25} - \frac{2a}{.75} = .5\), what is the value of a?
The sum of a rational number and its reciprocal is \( \frac{13}{6} \). Find the number.
What is the average of first 50 natural numbers?

What is the value of the following expression:

\(log \frac{a^2}{bc} + log \frac{b^2}{ca} + log \frac{c^2}{ab}\)

What is the simple interest on $3000 at 6 \( \frac{1}{4} \)% from \(4^{th}\) February 2005 to \(18^{th}\) April 2005 per annum?

Note: You must consider the day on which the money is withdrawn and not deposited.

If \(a = \sqrt2 - 1\), what is the value of the following expression:

\(a^4 + 4a^3 + 6a^2 + 4a + 7\)
If Bob loses \(20\%\) of his money and after spending \(70\%\) of the remaining amount, he is left with \(270 USD\). What was the original amount he had?
The population of a town is \(9000\), \(\frac{5}{9}\)th of them are males and rest are females. If \(40\%\) of the males are married, then what is the percent of married females?
If a reduction of \(20\%\) in the price of sugar enables a man to obtain \(2 kilograms\) more for \(80 USD\), then what is the reduced price of sugar per kilogram?
65% of a number is 21 less than \( \frac{4}{5} \)th of a number. Determine the number.
Fred walks at the rate of 4 km/hr for 2 hr 45 min and covers a certain distance. If he runs at the speed of 16.5 km/hr, then what is the time required to cover the same distance?
William travels a distance in 1hr 24 min by covering \( \frac{2}{3}th \) of the distance starting at 4 km/hr and the rest at 5 km/hr. What is the total distance covered?

A railway line consists of 15 railway stations. A ticket is required to travel between any two stations. Determine the number of tickets that the government must create for the smooth functioning of the ticketing system during all possibilities.

A locker contains a password of four digits. Alice forgot her password and she is trying all possible combinations to unlock the locker. She took 3 seconds for each try. The password is a combination of digits from 0 to 9. Determine the time taken by Alice to try all the combinations.
A bag consists of 10 black and 25 white balls. If three balls are randomly selected, then what is the probability that the selected balls are one black ball and 2 white balls?

Paul takes 8 hours to complete a job and Lisa takes 10 hours to complete the same job. If they both work together, then how long will they take to complete the job:

  1.  \(\frac {4}{9} \)
  2.  \(2\frac {4}{9}\)
  3.  \(3 \frac {4}{9}\)
  4.  \(4 \frac {4}{9}\)
Bob can complete a certain job in \(12\) days. Tara is \(60\%\) more efficient than Bob. How many days will Tara alone take to complete the same job?
Mary and Charles can complete a work in 4 days together. If Mary alone can complete the same work in 12 days, in how many days can Charles alone complete the work?
A student has to secure \(40\%\) marks to pass. He gets 160 marks and secures 20 marks more than passing marks required. Calculate the maximum number of marks.

If \(\frac{a}{2b} = \frac{1}{3}\), what is the value of the following expression:

\(\biggl( \) \(\frac{a + b}{a - b}\) \(\biggr)^3\)

Which of these is a factor of the following expression:

\(2a^2 - ab - 6b^2\)
The value of a machine depreciates at the rate of 10% per annum. If its current worth is USD 162,000, then what will be its worth after 2 years (in USD)?
Johnson works twice more than Ben to complete a work and together they can finish the work in 18 days. In how many days will Johnson alone finish the work?
